key_points: Tampa Bay Buccaneers coach Bruce Arians is impressed with Tom Brady's full-speed return to practice.
Brady had minor knee surgery after leading the Buccaneers to a Super Bowl title in February.
Despite the surgery, Brady is almost at 100 percent, participating fully in the team's first minicamp practice.
Tom Brady will turn 44 in August and has been working out and organizing team workouts.
There was some surprise that Brady was cleared fully for practice post-surgery.
Arians acknowledges the challenge in trying to limit Brady's practice time due to his eagerness.
Brady's performance potential for the upcoming season, following his successful 2020 season, is highlighted.
Entering Year 2 with the Bucs, Brady's understanding of the offensive system is expected to improve.
Increased comfort and familiarity with the system could make Brady and his receivers more dangerous.
Receiver Chris Godwin notes improved timing and understanding between Brady and the receivers.
